problem:
The exam grades of a pre-algebra class were arranged in a stem and leaf plot as illustrated. What is the arithmetic mean of the median and the mode of the given data?

\begin{tabular}{ c | c c c ccc c c c}
4&1&&&&&&&&\\
5&2&&&&&&&&\\
6&7&8&8&&&&&&\\
7&1&1&2&3&3&3&5&6&8\\
8&0&4&4&6&6&6&6&8&\\
9&1&3&5&5&7&&&&\\
\end{tabular}
solution:
Each digit to the right of the vertical bar represents (the units digit of) one exam grade. Counting the digits, we see that there are $27$ exam grades in all. Thus, the $14^{\rm th}$ grade in increasing order is the median (since there are $13$ grades smaller than it and $13$ grades larger than it). The chart makes it easy to read off the grades in increasing order -- we just read across the rows, from top to bottom. The $14^{\rm th}$ entry is $78,$ so that's the median grade.

The mode is the most frequently occurring grade. In this case, it's $86,$ which appears four times in the chart.

The arithmetic mean of the median and mode of the data is $\dfrac{1}{2}(78+86),$ or $\boxed{82}.$
model_solution:
Step 1: Find the mode of the data by locating the stem with the most leaves and listing the corresponding numbers in the order they appear in the stem-and-leaf plot.
Step 2: Find the median of the data by first listing all the values in order, which are 41, 42, 43, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 57, 58, 61, 62, 63, 63, 64, 65, 66, 66, 66, 66, 68, 70, 71, 71, 72, 73, 73, 73, 75, 76, 77, 81, 81, 83, 84, 84, 85, 86, 87, 88, 91, 93, 95, 95, 97, and then finding the middle number, which is 66.
Step 3: Calculate the arithmetic mean of the median and the mode, which is (66 + 66)/2 = 66.
Step 4: Determine if the mode found in Step 1 is correct by checking if there are any other stems with the same number of leaves as the selected stem.
Step 5: Count the number of leaves in the stem for 66 to verify if it is the stem with the most leaves.
Step 4: Determine if the mode found in Step 1 is correct by checking if there are any other stems with the same number of leaves as the selected stem.
